content.title: Vascular Rings
content.definition: Congenital anomalies in which abnormal aortic arch development results in complete or partial encirclement of the trachea and/or esophagus by vascular structures, causing compression and obstructive symptoms.

embryology.normal_development: Paired aortic arches → selective regression → left-sided arch with right-sided ligamentum
embryology.abnormal_development: Failure of normal regression or abnormal regression patterns
embryology.edwards_hypothetical_double_arch: Model for understanding all vascular ring variants

double_aortic_arch.anatomy: Both right and left arches persist, encircle trachea/esophagus
double_aortic_arch.surgical_approach: Divide smaller arch through left thoracotomy

right_arch_left_ligamentum.anatomy: Right aortic arch with left ligamentum arteriosum
right_arch_left_ligamentum.associated: Aberrant left subclavian artery and Kommerell diverticulum
right_arch_left_ligamentum.symptoms: Variable, may present later in life

pulmonary_artery_sling.anatomy: Left PA arises from right PA, courses between trachea and esophagus
pulmonary_artery_sling.associations: Complete tracheal rings (50%), long-segment tracheal stenosis
pulmonary_artery_sling.symptoms: Respiratory distress, often in neonatal period

innominate_artery_compression.anatomy: Anomalous origin causing anterior tracheal compression

content.statement: Vascular Rings is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Congenital that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Vascular Rings helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Vascular Rings include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Vascular Rings.

learning_objectives: Classify vascular rings as complete vs incomplete
Recognize clinical presentations suggesting vascular ring
Apply appropriate imaging modalities for diagnosis
clinical_pearls: Double aortic arch is most symptomatic - presents in infancy with stridor and feeding difficulties
Pulmonary artery sling is unique - posterior to trachea, often with complete tracheal rings
Aberrant right subclavian is often asymptomatic - 'dysphagia lusoria' when symptomatic
CT angiography with 3D reconstruction is the modality of choice for surgical planning
common_misconceptions: Misconception: All vascular rings require surgery - Reality: Some incomplete rings are asymptomatic and need only observation

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
